```{.r .cell-code}
library(readxl)
NFL_injuries <- read_excel("C:/Users/nicka/OneDrive/Desktop/Fall 2023/Data 399/nickya5.github.io/posts/NFL_injuries/NFL_injuries.xlsx")
View(NFL_injuries)
```

```{.r .cell-code}

```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] "Player"                         "Team"                          
 [3] "Place"                          "Date"                          
 [5] "Opposing_Team"                  "Divisional_Game"               
 [7] "Position"                       "Pre-Season_Injury?"            
 [9] "Week_of_Injury"                 "Season"                        
[11] "Weeks_Injured"                  "Games_Missed"                  
[13] "Unknown_Injury?"                "Reported_Injury_Type"          
[15] "Total_Snaps"                    "Average_Playtime_Before_Injury"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
NFL_injuries <- na.omit(NFL_injuries)

NFL_injuries$Place <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Place)
NFL_injuries$Opposing_Team <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Opposing_Team)
NFL_injuries$Position <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Position)
NFL_injuries$Week_of_Injury <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Week_of_Injury) # If it's categorical
NFL_injuries$Team <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Team)
NFL_injuries$Divisional_Game <- as.factor(NFL_injuries$Divisional_Game) # If it's categorical
# Continue for other categorical variables

# model <- lm(Reported_Injury_Type ~ Place + Opposing_Team + Position + Week_of_Injury + Team + Divisional_Game + Average_Playtime_Before_Injury, data = NFL_injuries)
```
